CatDescriptText: Mr. Henry Griffin, 311 Dinwiddie Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "I don't think so. Five days of school is enough.  If a child studies too hard, he might lose as much as he gains."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry Griffin wearing dark jacket and cap, holding Pittsburgh Post-Gazette newspaper, standing on sidewalk of belgian block street with storefronts in background
